posts.title: A Voter’s Dictionary of Important Terms
posts.text: Be an informed citizen and learn these 30 commonly used words and phrases that pertain to the election process—then join us on February 24th for an online trivia event!

posts.title: Perspectives on Voting: Books on Voting Rights, Voter Suppression & the Future of Voting
posts.text: Learn more about the long and contentious history of voting equality and initiatives for reform.

posts.title: What is Citizen Science?
posts.text: If you want to participate in real scientific studies - anywhere in the world - you'll want to find out about citizen science. Projects abound, from identifying sound pollution to swabbing your belly button for microbes.

posts.title: The NYC Commission on Human Rights
posts.text: After a recent visit from a representative of the NYC Commission on Human Rights, we'd like to share some facts about the Commission, and how they're ready to help anyone dealing with a discrimination issue.

posts.title: The Oprah Effect: The Lasting Power of Oprah and the Oprah Book Club
posts.text: To celebrate Oprah Winfrey's 65th birthday, we've collected some of the most memorable titles from Oprah's highly influential book club.

posts.title: Anthony Bourdain Recommends
posts.text: To celebrate the life of the famed chef and TV personality, we've put together a list of Anthony Bourdain's book recommendations, culled from interviews he gave.

posts.title: Grand Central Library Events & News: March 2018
posts.text: Get recommendations and check out upcoming must-see events for the Grand Central branch of NYPL.

posts.title: 2017 Book Club Recap
posts.text: With 12 months of 2017 Book Club activity in the books (pardon the pun), read on to find out what happens when people stop keeping their opinions to themselves, and start getting real...

posts.title: November 2017 at Grand Central
posts.text: Check out what's happening at Grand Central Library this month.

posts.title: October 2017 at Grand Central Library
posts.text: Learn what's happening at Grand Central Library.

posts.title: September 2017 at Grand Central Library
posts.text: Read up on the latest news from Grand Central Library.

posts.title: Streaming Video with Overdrive: Leading Ladies Edition
posts.text: Now, using Overdrive, you can stream over 600 feature films, documentaries, foreign films, and children's videos with only your library card!

posts.title: Current Feminist Writers
posts.text: There are many diverse feminist voices writing right now. This list—from books to TEDTalks—will help direct you toward some of these voices.

posts.title: AI, Climate Change & More: Navigating Scientific Resources at the Library
posts.text: Allow the Library to help you sift through the world of artificial intelligence, climate change, and even the phone in your pocket.

posts.title: Hamilton: The Mixtape Edition
posts.text: As if we needed another reason, there is now even more to love about "Hamilton": On December 2, the "Hamilton" Mixtape is dropping with appearances from some amazing artists.

posts.title: Your October Playlist : 8 Recommendations
posts.text: In the weeks leading up to Halloween we watch scary movies and we read scary stories but are we listening to enough scary music? No, probably not! Here are some suggestions to get you in the spooky spirit.

posts.title: Get a Hobby! 5 Suggestions from Grand Central Library
posts.text: Just because you vowed never to write another term paper again does not mean you are done learning. This back-to-school season, try picking up a new hobby rather than a new textbook. Some of our well-rounded librarians are here to give you ideas!

posts.title: Pet Safety Tips
posts.text: Enjoy the summer with your four-legged friends, and make sure they stay happy and healthy.

posts.title: Recent Hip Hop You May Have Missed
posts.text: Six suggestions for your summer.

posts.title: All About Historic Building Preservation
posts.text: May is Historic Preservation Month! Here are some recommended reads to get you into the building preservation mood no matter where your interests lie.

posts.title: Spring Cleaning in 5 Steps
posts.text: Get inspired to freshen up your space this spring with the help of these free books from the library.

posts.title: The Journey from Blog to Book
posts.text: Learn a thing or two from Jenny, Julie, Allie, and Perez. Here’s a guide to some popular blogs that were turned into even more popular books!
